docfields.name: Sonnet::BackgroundChecker
docfields.text: You can use it as is by calling the checkText function or subclass it and reimplement getMoreText function The misspelling signal is emitted whenever a misspelled word is found The background checker stops right before emitting the signal So the parent has to call continueChecking function to resume the checking done signal is emitted when whole text is spell checked Zack Rusin class used for spell checking in the background

docfields.name: Sonnet::BackgroundChecker::continueChecking
docfields.text: The catcher is responsible for calling continueChecking function to resume checking

docfields.name: Sonnet::BackgroundChecker::setText
docfields.text: It automatically invokes start() Use fetchMoreText() with start() to spell check a stream

docfields.name: Sonnet::BackgroundChecker::fetchMoreText
docfields.text: It will be called continuesly until it returns QString() in which case the done() signal is emitted Note the start parameter in mispelling() is not a combined position but a position in the last string returned by fetchMoreText You need to store the state in the derivatives

docfields.name: Sonnet::ConfigDialog::languageChanged
docfields.text: language the language which the user has selected 4.1

docfields.name: Sonnet::ConfigDialog::setLanguage
docfields.text: This overrides the setting in the config file language the language which will be selected by default 4.1

docfields.name: Sonnet::ConfigWidget::language
docfields.text: Returns an empty string if kdelibs was built without any spellchecking plugins the language currently selected in the language combobox 4.1

docfields.name: Sonnet::ConfigWidget::setLanguage
docfields.text: This overrides the setting in the config file language the language which will be selected by default 4.1

docfields.name: Sonnet::Dialog
docfields.text: You can change buffer inside a slot connected to done() signal and spellcheck will continue with new data automatically

docfields.name: Sonnet::Dialog::done
docfields.text: Also emitted after stop() signal

docfields.name: Sonnet::Dialog::languageChanged
docfields.text: dictionary the new language the user selected 4.1

docfields.name: Sonnet::Dialog::setSpellCheckContinuedAfterReplacement
docfields.text: By default it is continued 4.4

docfields.name: Sonnet::Dialog::showProgressDialog
docfields.text: By default no progress dialog is shown If the progress dialog is set to be shown no time consuming operation for example showing a notification message should be performed in a slot connected to the done signal as this might trigger the progress dialog unnecessarily timeout time after which the progress dialog should appear a negative value can be used to hide it 4.4

docfields.name: Sonnet::Dialog::showSpellCheckCompletionMessage
docfields.text: By default it is not shown 4.4

docfields.name: Sonnet::DictionaryComboBox
docfields.text: Ingo Kloecker Tom Albers 4.2

docfields.name: Sonnet::DictionaryComboBox::dictionaryChanged
docfields.text: Either by user intervention or on setCurrentByDictionaryName() or on setCurrentByDictionary() For example

docfields.name: Sonnet::DictionaryComboBox::dictionaryNameChanged
docfields.text: Either by user intervention or on setCurrentByDictionaryName() or on setCurrentByDictionary() For example

docfields.name: Sonnet::DictionaryComboBox::reloadCombo
docfields.text: Remember to set the dictionary you want selected after calling this function

docfields.name: Sonnet::GuessLanguage
docfields.text: GuessLanguage can determine the differnce between languages for a given string It is based off a perl script origionaly written by Maciej Ceglowski called Languid His script used a 2 part huristic to determine language First the text is is checked for the scripts it contains then for each set of languages useing those scripts a n-gram frequency model of a given language is compared to a model of the text The most similar language model is assumed to be the language If no language is found an empty string is returned Jacob Rideout 4.3

docfields.name: Sonnet::GuessLanguage::GuessLanguage
docfields.text: If text is specified it sets the text to be checked text the text that is to be checked

docfields.name: Sonnet::GuessLanguage::identify
docfields.text: Three digits are returned only in the case where a 2 digit code does not exist If text isn t empty set the text to checked text to be identified list of the presumed languages of the text sorted by decreasing confidence Empty list means it is impossible to determine language with confidence required by setLimits

docfields.name: Sonnet::GuessLanguage::setLimits
docfields.text: The confidence for each language is computed as difference between this and next language on the list normalized to 0-1 range Reasonable value to get fairly sure result is 0.1 Default is returning best guess without caring about confidence exactly as after call to setLimits(1,0) maxItems The list returned by identify() will never have more than maxItems item minConfidence The list will have only enough items for their summary confidence equal or exceed minConfidence

docfields.name: Sonnet::Highlighter::activeChanged
docfields.text: description is a i18n description of the new state with an optional reason

docfields.name: Sonnet::Highlighter::setCurrentLanguage
docfields.text: language the language code for the new language to use

docfields.name: Sonnet::Highlighter::Highlighter
docfields.text: textEdit col define spellchecking color 5.12

docfields.name: Sonnet::Highlighter::addWordToDictionary
docfields.text: It will never be marked as misspelled again even after restarting the application word the word which will be added to the dictionary 4.1

docfields.name: Sonnet::Highlighter::automatic
docfields.text: true if spell checking is automatically disabled if there s too many errors

docfields.name: Sonnet::Highlighter::currentLanguage
docfields.text: the language code for the current language

docfields.name: Sonnet::Highlighter::ignoreWord
docfields.text: This word will not be marked misspelled for this session It will again be marked as misspelled when creating new highlighters word the word which will be ignored 4.1

docfields.name: Sonnet::Highlighter::isActive
docfields.text: true if spell checking is active setActive()

docfields.name: Sonnet::Highlighter::isWordMisspelled
docfields.text: word the word to be checked true if the given word is misspelled 4.1

docfields.name: Sonnet::Highlighter::setActive
docfields.text: If active is true then spell checking is enabled otherwise it is disabled Note that you have to disable automatic de activation with setAutomatic() before you change the state of spell checking if you want to persistently enable/disable spell checking active if true then spell checking is enabled isActive() setAutomatic()

docfields.name: Sonnet::Highlighter::setAutomatic
docfields.text: automatic if true spell checking will be disabled if there s a significant amount of errors

docfields.name: Sonnet::Highlighter::setDocument
docfields.text: document the new document to operate on

docfields.name: Sonnet::Highlighter::spellCheckerFound
docfields.text: true if spell checking is supported for the current language

docfields.name: Sonnet::Highlighter::suggestionsForWord
docfields.text: If the word is not misspelled the list will be empty word the misspelled word max at most this many suggestions will be returned If this is as many suggestions as the spell backend supports will be returned a list of suggested replacements for the word 4.1

docfields.name: Sonnet::SpellCheckDecorator
docfields.text: Aurélien Gâteau 5.0

docfields.name: Sonnet::SpellCheckDecorator::SpellCheckDecorator
docfields.text: textEdit the QTextEdit in need of spell-checking It also is used as the QObject parent for the decorator

docfields.name: Sonnet::SpellCheckDecorator::SpellCheckDecorator
docfields.text: textEdit the QPlainTextEdit in need of spell-checking It also is used as the QObject parent for the decorator 5.12

docfields.name: Sonnet::SpellCheckDecorator::setHighlighter
docfields.text: SpellCheckDecorator does not take ownership of the new highlighter and you must manually delete the old highlighter

docfields.name: Sonnet::Speller
docfields.text: class used for actuall spell checking

docfields.name: Sonnet::Speller::addToPersonal
docfields.text: true on success

docfields.name: Sonnet::Speller::addToSession
docfields.text: true on success

docfields.name: Sonnet::Speller::availableBackends
docfields.text: ISpell ASpell

docfields.name: Sonnet::Speller::availableLanguageNames
docfields.text: Note use availableDictionaries

docfields.name: Sonnet::Speller::availableLanguages
docfields.text: Note use availableDictionaries

docfields.name: Sonnet::Speller::isCorrect
docfields.text: false if the word is misspelled true otherwise

docfields.name: Sonnet::Speller::isMisspelled
docfields.text: true if the word is misspelled false otherwise

docfields.name: Sonnet::Speller::storeReplacement
docfields.text: true on success

docfields.name: Sonnet::Speller::suggest
docfields.text: list of all suggestions for the word

docfields.name: index
docfields.text: Sonnet Multi-language spell checker Introduction Sonnet is a plugin-based spell checking library for Qt-based applications It supports several different plugins including HSpell Enchant ASpell and HUNSPELL It also supports automated language detection based on a combination of different algorithms The simplest way to use Sonnet in your application is to use the SpellCheckDecorator class on your QTextEdit Example
